item.question:
Consider the following commandline:
What does the above commandline do?
item.choice: Syntax error as an opening bracket must be preceeded by an <font face="monospace">if</font>-keyword.
Execute <font face="monospace">/usr/bin/xterm</font> if it has execution permission set.
Check if <font face="monospace">/usr/bin/xterm</font> has execution permissions and if so will not execute <font face="monospace">/usr/bin/xterm</font>
Simultaneously run two instances of <font face="monospace">/usr/bin/xterm</font>
item.correct_answer: Execute <font face="monospace">/usr/bin/xterm</font> if it has execution permission set.
item.hint: If you are not certain you might get lucky and another question may give you a clue for the correct answer.

item.question: Which of the following BEST describes what the <font face="monospace">/etc/skel</font> directory is used for?
item.choice: When the system boots the contents of the <font face="monospace">/etc/skel</font> directory is read and depending on the runlevel the scripts are executed.
Each time a user logs in the contents of <font face="monospace">/etc/skel</font> is used to initialize the shell environment.
The contents of the directory can be used to provide a default environment when new users are created.
It contains the configuration files for the application <font face="monospace">skel</font>.
item.correct_answer: The contents of the directory can be used to provide a default environment when new users are created.
item.hint: If you are not certain you might get lucky and another question may give you a clue for the correct answer.

addresses there are reserved for the router and a nameserver. How many IP adresses are left for other hosts?

item.question:
In the passwd file, you changed /bin/bash to
/bin/false for user bob. What best describes the effect on bob's
account?
item.choice: When bob logs in on a terminal screen it will run the command <font face="monospace">/bin/false</font>
Bob will be asked to provide a new shell to use
item.correct_answer: When bob logs in on a terminal screen it will run the command <font face="monospace">/bin/false</font>
item.hint: If you are not certain you might get lucky and another question may give you a clue for the correct answer.

item.question: You need to add user guru0 to the group students. Which of the following commands will be BEST to perform this task?
item.hint: These kind of questions are great for answering other questions, as it clearly tells you which command you can use to modify a user account. To answer this question correctly you must know which option will add the group to the user's additional groups. Although you can make the user a member of the group by changing its primary group. The question mentions adding the user to the group and not replacing acurrent group membership. So your safest bet would be to add the group to the user's additional groups.

item.question: A user calls claiming that the monitor does not work. You remember adding an extra network-card to her machine yesterday and did not test the new setup because of an urgent meeting. You have a feeling that the network card might be conflicting with the video-card. Which file would you check to see if there are any hardware address conflicts?
item.hint: If you are not certain you might get lucky and another question may give you a clue for the correct answer.

item.question: What is the purpose of the <font face="monospace">export</font> command?
item.choice: To save the history file to a compatible format to be used by other shells.
To run a command in the current shell instead of a child-shell.
To setup environment variables for applications started in the shell.
item.correct_answer: To setup environment variables for applications started in the shell.
item.hint: If you are not certain you might get lucky and another question may give you a clue for the correct answer.

item.question:
Your company policy does not allow anything but ssh as a remote login service.
During your monthly security audit you discover that one of your machines provides remote login services
on port 23. What would you do?
item.choice: Deactivate it, you dont need a SMTP server there.
Deactivate it, you should not use <font face="monospace">telnet</font>.
Nothing, this is ok as <font face="monospace">ssh</font> is a safe login service.
Setup a firewall on the machine to block traffic to port 23.
item.correct_answer: Deactivate it, you should not use <font face="monospace">telnet</font>.
item.hint: If you are not certain you might get lucky and another question may give you a clue for the correct answer.

item.question: The above exhibit for contains a line from the file <font face="monospace">/etc/passwd</font>. Which of the following statements is true, based on the information in the exhibit?
item.choice: User <font face="monospace">guru1</font> belongs to the group with GID 5102.
The username <font face="monospace">guru1</font> belongs to the group <font face="monospace">GURU 1</font>.
Members of the group with GID 5001 can read directory <font face="monospace">/home/guru1</font>.
The file <font face="monospace">/etc/passwd</font> is corrupt as you may not use space-characters in a passwd-entry.

item.question: Which of the following statements best describes the output in above exhibit.
item.choice: All sources will be inquired once every 64 seconds.
The system will synchronize with <font face="monospace">ams1.x31.com</font> or <font face="monospace">243-51-223.ftth</font> or <font face="monospace">ntp0.mediamatic</font>.
The system clock is running slow.
The system will synchronize with <font face="monospace">sip.dicode.nl</font> or <font face="monospace">europium.canoni</font>.
item.correct_answer: All sources will be inquired once every 64 seconds.

item.question:
Consider the following command:
What will be the result?
item.choice: The primary bash prompt includes the username and hostname
The primary bash prompt includes the current working directory and hostname
The secondary bash prompt includes the username and hostname
The secondary bash prompt includes the username and full hostname
item.correct_answer: The primary bash prompt includes the username and hostname

item.question: A user calls and complains that he/she cannot work with the text-editor that is started when he/she wants to write an email using a text-oriented mailprogram like <font face="monospace">mutt</font> or <font face="monospace">pine</font>. Which file is best to edit to define a different default text-editor?
item.hint: The skel directory is only effective for new users. The question is about changing the pager for an existing user and only a single user. Therefore, it boils down to knowing the difference between <font face="monospace">.bashrc</font> and <font face="monospace">.bash_profile</font>.

item.question: You want to do a routine checkup on your system to see if anyone is trying to hack your way into the system. Which of the following commandlines would you use to check how many times remote users have opened a secure shell to the system?
